summary:
Founder & Artistic Director of Ballet Rising 2019 - Present

Ballet Rising is a community development organization dedicated to making ballet more accessible by Empowering  Emerging Ballet Communities in the most unlikely places. We address a lack of connectivity at the edges of the global ballet community with the aim of expanding opportunities and collaboration through Financial Support, Networking, and Awareness.

Ballet Rising goes beyond nurturing dancers and talent discovery. We promote ballet's wide-ranging benefits for all, contributing to a positive impact on society.

Guest Teacher - 2015 - Present

After retiring from a 22-year dance career, I embraced teaching ballet worldwide. As a guest instructor, I journeyed through Latin America, the US, Africa, Europe, South Asia, and East Asia, sharing my expertise, judging competitions, and witnessing the unifying influence of dance across diverse cultures.

Dance Career

2016 - 2018:  Freelance Guest Artist
2017: Guest Principal - Royal New Zealand Ballet (Wellington, New Zealand)
2008 - 2016:  Principal Dancer - Dutch National Ballet (Amsterdam, The Netherlands) 
2014 - 2015:  Guest Principal - English National Ballet (London, UK) 
2014:  Guest Principal - Lithuanian National Ballet (Vilnius, Lithuania) 
2013:  Guest Principal - Pacific Northwest Ballet (Seattle, USA) 
2009 - 2010:  Guest Principal - San Francisco Ballet (San Francisco, USA) 
2007:  Guest principal - Dutch National Ballet (Amsterdam, The Netherlands) 
1999 - 2008:  Principal Dancer - Pacific Northwest Ballet (Seattle, USA) 
1997 - 1999:  American Ballet Theatre (New York City, USA) 

Leading roles in ballets by choreographers: George Balanchine, William Forsythe, Nacho Duato, Twyla Tharp, Justin Peck, John Neumeier, Glen Tetley, Jerome Robbins, David Dawson, Alexei Ratmansky, Rudy Van Dantzig, Hans van Manen, Helgi Tomasson, Christopher Wheeldon, Jean-Christophe Maillot, Ronald Hynd, Paul Taylor, Wayne Eagling, David Parsons, Lynne Taylor-Corbett, Merce Cunningham, Ulysses Dove, Derek Deane,  Jorma Elo, Lar Lubovitch, Mayne Mcgregor and many more.

projects: [{'title': 'Ballet Rising Documentary Film Series', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Casey', 'last_name': 'Herd', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder / Director at Ballet Rising'}]}, {'title': 'A Moving Journey', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': '"A Moving Journey" by Willem Spaan captures the inspiring stories of Syrian ballet dancer Ahmad Joudeh (subject of the film Dance Or Die) and Brazilian ballet dancer Daniel Robert Silva (subject of the film Esperança) through a stunning series of five photographs. The stream of light that flows through each image represents their personal journeys and how ballet gave them hope to pursue their dreams. The light passes from one image to the next, weaving together the two dancers\' stories until it converges in the middle where they\'re featured together in the center. Through this project, Spaan and Ballet Rising are not only highlighting the transformative power of dance but also raising funds for a documentary film series that showcases ballet in unexpected and underserved communities around the world. With "A Moving Journey," Spaan and Ballet Rising are illuminating the beauty and resilience of the human spirit, inspiring us all to follow our own paths with hope and determination.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Casey', 'last_name': 'Herd', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder / Director at Ballet Rising'}]}, {'title': 'Esperança', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "As part of Ballet Rising's mission to celebrate ballet's global diversity and narratives from unexpected corners, I embarked on a poignant journey in 2019 to Brazil, unveiling the inspiring story of Daniel Robert Silva, a talented artist from humble origins now shining bright in the Dutch National Ballet. His journey exemplifies the profound impact of passion and dedication, transcending barriers and kindling aspirations. Crafted into a captivating documentary film, this narrative reached its pinnacle in December 2022, premiering to a worldwide audience, a testament to the unifying and transformative power of ballet across cultures and countries.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Casey', 'last_name': 'Herd', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder / Director at Ballet Rising'}]}, {'title': 'Canta Ballet', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': "On June 28 2012, the Dutch National Ballet executed a ballet especially written for dancers and cars for the disabled - the Canta. All in all, there were 55 Canta's and 50 ballet dancers performing.\n\nThe pièce de resistance of the ballet was a double pas-de-deux. First, two principals of the  Dutch National Ballet (Casey Herd and Marisa Lopez) performed a pas-de-deux, immediately followed by a pas-de-deux between Casey Herd and prima Canta Karin Spaink.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Casey', 'last_name': 'Herd', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder / Director at Ballet Rising'}]}]
